lexUnit.name: peruse.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: read or examine thoroughly or carefully.

sentence.text: Sooner than he had expected , Harry found himself back in Swindon Central Library , this time perusing the national newspapers for 2 June 1987 in the hope of gleaning from them some clue as to what had eluded him on his visit to Tyler 's Hard .
Warner Bros remained committed to social drama and their ideas boys eagerly perused the papers for potential stories .
But also that any who might peruse this essay from a research perspective will feel that I have not been too cavalier in the implications that I draw from the results of their studies .
If what you want is to peruse a publication like Big Women , you 'll find it in a discreet magazine rack in a corner of the Smoking Room .
Manville perused the cryptic message with satisfaction .
As soon as the man 's wallet was in his hand , the Doctor retreated hastily back to the car to peruse the contents .
` Donald perused it , looked up at me , scratched his head , grinned , and said , ` Not bad .
Cornelius perused the premises .
It is vital that these documents should be perused by any medical expert as well as you .
All the entries can then be perused at leisure in a popular year-long exhibition in the foyer of the Ark Restaurant .
Later documents will be perused rather than analysed thoroughly in the hope that any new information is revealed in the process .
I perused the beast and proclaimed that it was indeed a woolly mammoth , of the genus Mammuthus primigenius .
I decided to rest those particular enquiries until at least I had perused Bligh-Bond 's weighty tomes .
Bear this in mind when you peruse the catalogues and the plants on offer in the nursery garden centre plunge beds .
ULSTER 'S richest residents have wasted no time perusing the most expensive house ever to go on the market here .
` Shall we peruse Mr Kobold 's intended purchase ? "
As he sipped at his coffee he perused the extraordinary news sheet .

Dowd perused his newly polished shoes .
My bookshelf is sagging under the weight of all my The Artist magazines , all in order of date and so often taken out to peruse back numbers .
We do not expect that he perused every word of the book .
He peruses it and , as he and his wife will be starting their annual vacation the following Monday , Teignmouth is decided upon .
But also that any who might peruse this essay from a research perspective will feel that I have not been too cavalier in the implications that I draw from the results of their studies .
I decided to rest those particular enquiries until at least I had perused Bligh-Bond 's weighty tomes .
He perused the long columns of journalistic licence which covered the Mercury 's front page .
On perusing the pages of White 's 1856 directory it is noticeable how many of these small market towns had been rebuilt and improved during the first half of the nineteenth century .
